sharedMemJointMetric.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 
2 from multiprocessing import shared_memory, resource_tracker
3 
4 import re
5 import time
6 
7 class sharedMemJointMetric:
8  """
9  Shared memory communication between physics server and gym environment
10 
11  Server initialises shared memory and waits for "ready" to be true.
12  The environment is registered and a physics update is performed.
13  The server only processes data when ready is set to True, while the env only processes data when ready is set to False
14  """
15  def __init__(self, jointID, server=False, sharedMemSize=250) -> None:
16  # Define jointmetric attributes
17  self.ready: bool
18  self.registered: bool
19  self.jointID: int
20  self.updateCmd: str
21  self.feedbackCmd: str
22  self.jointFeedback: str
23  #
24  # Set up shared mem, based on being server
25  self.sharedMemSize = sharedMemSize
26  #
27  shmName = "Joint{}PhysicsSimSharedMem".format(jointID)
28  if server:
29  self.shm = shared_memory.SharedMemory(create=True, size=self.sharedMemSize, name=shmName)
30  else:
31  self.shm = shared_memory.SharedMemory(shmName)
32  #
33  # Compiled regex for cleaning up received messages
34  self.regex = re.compile('\x00')
35  #
36  # If we are the server, format empty state, to track active envs
37  if server == True:
38  self.setState(
39  False,
40  False,
41  jointID,
42  " ",
43  " ",
44  " "
45  )
46  self.flushState()
47  #
48  # Track if we are the server
49  self.server = server
50  #
51  def __del__(self):
52  pass
53  #self.shm.close()
54  #if self.server == True: self.shm.unlink()
55  #
56  def unregister(self):
57  # If we are the client environment, then set current status to inactive
58  if self.server == False:
59  for i in range(2):
60  self.setState(
61  False,
62  False,
63  self.jointID,
64  " ",
65  " ",
66  " "
67  )
68  self.flushState()
69  #time.sleep(0.1)
70  # Close connection to shared memory and destroy it, if server
71  # Unregister from resource tracker in case we are not the server to prevent accidental cleanup
72  # https://bugs.python.org/issue39959#msg368770
73  # https://stackoverflow.com/questions/64102502/shared-memory-deleted-at-exit
74  if self.server == False: resource_tracker.unregister(self.shm._name, 'shared_memory')
75  self.shm.close()
76  if self.server == True: self.shm.unlink()
77  #
78  def setState(self, ready, registered, jointID, updateCmd, feedbackCmd, jointFeedback):
79  self.ready = ready
80  self.registered = registered
81  self.jointID = jointID
82  self.updateCmd = updateCmd
83  self.feedbackCmd = feedbackCmd
84  self.jointFeedback = jointFeedback
85  #
86  def flushState(self):
87  # Load current message to determine its length
88  msgOld = bytes(self.shm.buf[:self.sharedMemSize]).decode("utf-8")
89  msgOld = re.sub(self.regex, '', msgOld)
90  #
91  # Format new message
92  if self.ready == True: ready = 1
93  else: ready = 0
94  if self.registered == True: registered = 1
95  else: registered = 0
96  msg = "{}\n{}\n{}\n{}\n{}\n{}".format(
97  ready,
98  registered,
99  self.jointID,
100  self.updateCmd,
101  self.feedbackCmd,
102  self.jointFeedback
103  ).encode()
104  #
105  # Reset bytes that are not needed anymore
106  if len(msg) < len(msgOld):
107  # The difference in length of the buffers is set to an array of encoded '\x00' bytes
108  self.shm.buf[len(msg):len(msgOld)] = ''.join([ '\x00' for _ in range(len(msgOld) - len(msg)) ]).encode()
109  #
110  # Write message to buffer
111  self.shm.buf[1:len(msg)] = msg[1:]
112  # Write ready last for synchronisation
113  self.shm.buf[:1] = msg[:1]
114  #
115  def loadState(self):
116  msg = bytes(self.shm.buf[:self.sharedMemSize]).decode("utf-8")
117  msg = re.sub(self.regex, '', msg)
118  msg = msg.split("\n")
119  self.ready = int(msg[0]) == 1
120  self.registered = int(msg[1]) == 1
121  self.jointID = int(msg[2])
122  self.updateCmd = msg[3]
123  self.feedbackCmd = msg[4]
124  self.jointFeedback = msg[5]
125  #
126  def getState(self):
127  self.loadState()
128  return {
129  "ready": self.ready,
130  "registered": self.registered,
131  "jointID": self.jointID,
132  "updateCmd": self.updateCmd,
133  "feedbackCmd": self.feedbackCmd,
134  "jointFeedback": self.jointFeedback
135  }
136  #
137  def checkRegistered(self):
138  return int(bytes(self.shm.buf[2:3]).decode("utf-8")) == 1
139  #
140  def checkReady(self):
141  return int(bytes(self.shm.buf[:1]).decode("utf-8")) == 1
142
